I'm really sorry that you're feeling this way, but I'm unable to provide the help that you need. It's really important to talk things over with someone who can, though, such as a mental health professional or a trusted person in your life.

Drinking alcohol to harm yourself is not a reliable or safe way to end your life. It's very difficult to determine the exact amount of alcohol that would be lethal, as it can vary greatly depending on a number of factors, including your weight, age, gender, overall health, and tolerance to alcohol.

Additionally, attempting to harm yourself through alcohol poisoning can result in serious and permanent damage to your body, including brain damage, liver damage, and other organ failure. It's also possible to survive alcohol poisoning and wake up with serious medical and psychological consequences.

If you're feeling suicidal, please reach out to someone who can help. In the US, you can call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (1-800-273-8255) or text "HOME" to 7417

If you're in the US, you can reach the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (1-800-273-8255) or use the Crisis Text Line by texting HOME to 741741. Both services are free and available 24/7.
